snippet: The state’s top court said that, in most instances, the police must obtain a warrant before they can obtain tracking information about a suspect.
abstract: New Jersey Supreme Court orders that, in most instances, police will need a search warrant before obtaining tracking information from cellphone providers about a suspect; ruling involves case that began with string of burglaries; decision underscores extent of battles over government intrusion into personal data.
lead_paragraph: The state’s top court said that, in most instances, the police must obtain a warrant before they can obtain tracking information about a suspect.

headline.main: New Jersey Supreme Court Restricts Police Searches of Phone Data
headline.print_headline: Court Restricts Police Searches Of Phone Data
